alert.note: Alert for Oahu in Honolulu (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 29 at 7:03AM HST until April 29 at 8:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF OAHU IN HONOLULU COUNTY... At 703 AM HST, radar indicated that the areal coverage of the heaviest rainfall continued to diminish this morning. Radar showed rainfall rates around 1 inch per hour, locally up to 2 inches per hour, now with the showers moving over windward Oahu this morning. Gauges on the Kaluanui, Punaluu and Waikane Streams show stream flows have peaked and continue to trend downward as rainfall rates diminish. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waikane, Waiahole, Kahaluu, Kaaawa, Ahuimanu, Punaluu, Pearl City, Mililani, Aiea, Hauula, Wahiawa, Halawa, Moanalua, Kaneohe, Salt Lake, Laie, Kaneohe Marine Base, Kalihi, Maunawili and Kahuku. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
